tit.e: A street vendor's stall (Yatai in Japanese)
A street vendor's stall (Yatai in Japanese)

sen.j: 屋台（やたい）は、移動式の簡易店舗。
sen.e: A street vendor's stall, Yatai, is a simple mobile store.
A street vendor's stall, Yatai, is a simple mobile store.
A street vendor's stall (Yatai in Japanese) is a simple mobile store.

sen.j: 多くの場合、飲食店を指すが、その他玩具などを売る場合もあり、その場合露店（ろてん）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: In many cases, this street stall is a mobile restaurant; some stores exclusively sell toys and other goods, and this type of street vendor stall is also known as a Roten.

sen.j: 初期の形態としては、天秤棒で担いで売り歩いた形態があったが商品を多く運べないのが欠点。
sen.e: This vendor form developed early on, from the seller walking about vending goods contained in a shoulder pole; this method was a significant disadvantage, in that the vendors product inventory was limited to all one could carry.

sen.j: 屋台は江戸時代に大きく繁栄し、江戸（後の東京）では、寿司や蕎麦、天ぷらといったすぐに提供できる食べ物（ファーストフード）が屋台で初めて提供された。
sen.e: The street stall business prospered greatly in the Edo period, food (first food) which a seller could immediately offer; such as sushi, soba (noodles made from buckwheat), and tempura; vendors were provided their first street stall store opportunities in Edo (later Tokyo)

sen.j: これは江戸時代の夜鳴きそばに起源を発し、チャルメラをならしながら夜の街を流すため、別名チャルメラと呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: Yonaki-soba (buckwheat noodles sold at movable stands on winter evenings) in the Edo period, originated in the Ramen Shops; Yonaki-soba shop vendors, walked around the streets at night making sounds with a charamela (charamela in Portuguese, shawm in English, a street vendor's flute), so the street stall was also called a Charamela.

sen.j: 営業には食品衛生法に基づく保健所の営業許可や道路交通法に基づく警察署の道路使用許可が必要。
sen.e: In order to run the street stall business, a vendor is required to obtain an operating license from the health care center; this is mandated by The Food Sanitation Act; also a vender is required a road usage license, from a Police Office, under The Road Traffic Act.

sen.j: 水道、排水、電気、トイレの確保やゴミ処理が難しく、深夜の騒音問題、衛生面での問題や道路を占拠し交通を妨害するなどの問題もあり、最近ではこの種の屋台は減ってきている。
sen.e: The operational impediment to a street stall business is not only limited by licensing; there are other significant obstacles contributed to the vendor's declining business: Obtaining a water supply, drainage, electricity, bathroom facilities; there is difficulty in trash and waste management, and problems with noise and hygiene; then the problem with occupying a roadway and blocking traffic.

sen.e: Licenses are not the only impediments to owning a street stall business; there are other significant obstacles that are contributing to the vendor's decline: obtaining a water supply, drainage, electricity, bathroom facilities; trash and waste can be difficult to manage, together with problems with noise and hygiene; not to mention issues that occur from taking up a roadway and blocking traffic.

sen.j: 常設的に屋台を開設するには向いていない日本気候条件の制約等がある。
sen.e: Another factor is the impediment of Japan's climate; this can limit the street vendor's ability to develop and maintain a permanent establishment.

tit.cmt: 行政による、を戻しました。

sen.j: これらの屋台の営業は、保健所の食品衛生法に基づく許可や福岡県警の道路交通法に基づく道路使用許可が必要で、また、使用許可手数料も徴収される。
sen.e: The operation a street stall business requires a health center permit, under the Food Sanitation Act; permission to use the road is administered by the Fukuoka police station, under the Road Traffic Act; the owners of the business pay the permit licensing fee.

sen.j: 営業できるのは間口3メートル、奥行き2.5メートルまで。

sen.j: 店外にテーブルやビールケースを出したり、歩道を占拠する営業は違法となるなど、規制がある。
sen.e: It is the illegal to place a table or a beer case outside of the premises of the street stall shops, or to occupy the roadway while doing business; those are the regulations.

sen.j: 福岡県、福岡市、県警とも衛生面などの問題から規制を行ってきた。

sen.j: これに対して屋台側も県議会議員や厚生労働省（当時）を巻き込んだ抵抗運動を行った。

sen.j: 1962年には、営業許可基準、道路使用許可制度、道路使用取扱要綱などが決定された。

sen.j: 1970年代に入ると県警が道路使用許可の名義変更を認めない方針を打ち出すが、1973年に屋台側が県警と交渉した結果、条件付きながら名義変更を認める譲歩案を引き出した。
sen.e: In the 1970's, Fukuoka Prefecture Police proposed a policy which did not accept a change of ownership; but later, the street stall business representatives negotiated with the Fukuoka Prefecture Police; thus in '1973', obtaining a compromise for acceptance in the change the of ownership with conditions.

sen.e: In August of 1981, the problem of road usage licensing reignited; Fukuoka City decided to resume the discussion on the basic 'recognition problem' of street stalls.

sen.j: 1994年10月には、県警が道路使用許可の名義に関して、以下の方針を打ち出した。
sen.e: In October of 1994, the Fukuoka Prefecture Police proposed rules on ownership and road usage licensing: "For street stall businesses, the ownership right of road usage licensing's validity is limited to a single individual for the lifetime of the business; any transferred ownership rights in the street stall business, which permitted road usage licensing, would now be restricted to family members or relatives living with in the same household.

sen.j: 福岡市は、屋台は観光資源でもあることから、道路使用許可の条件に満たない屋台の使用許可に関してもなかば黙認していたが、その存在を法的に認めていたわけではなかった。
sen.e: Since the street stalls were tourist attractions in Fukuoka City, the city loosely tolerated the usage of the street stall shops which were not in compliance with the restrictive conditions, failing to obtain the usage licensing; but the city never officially recognized the existence of the street stall business as a legal entity.

sen.j: このグレーゾーン状態を解消するため、1996年から福岡市は「屋台問題検討会」を発足させ、基本方針を検討。
sen.e: In order to resolve and clear up this gray area of the road usage licensing code, Fukuoka City established an "investigative commission on the street stall issue" and discussed the basic principal in 1996.

sen.j: 2000年5月18日に「福岡市屋台指導要綱」を告示。
sen.e: Fukuoka City, defined its position in a notification entitled "Fukuoka City street stall guidelines" on May 18, 2000.
Fukuoka City, defined its position in a notification entitled "Fukuoka City street stall guidelines" on May 18, 2000.

sen.j: 屋台を合法的な存在と認める代わりに、屋台に関する様々な規制を明確化し、要綱に合致しない屋台の移転・再配置を明示した。
sen.e: In exchange for legalizing the existence of the street stalls as a business entity, Fukuoka City would now establish clearly detailed regulations about the operations of the street stall businesses; the city stated that, 'street stalls businesses, might be moved or repositioned, if the shops were not to meet the guidelines.'

In exchange for legalizing the existence of street stalls as a business entity, Fukuoka City would now establish clearly detailed regulations governing the operations of street stalls; the city stated that, 'street stalls businesses, might be moved or repositioned, if the shops did not meet the guidelines.'

sen.e: An emerging point of view of the local residents, in the last few years, is a dislike for the street stalls; this is because of the traffic inconvenience, and the strong odors created by the food and food preparation.

tit.e: The street stalls of the East Asia

sen.j: 台湾では、早朝から粥、麺類、魯肉飯、米加工品、サンドイッチ、フレンチトースト、おにぎりなどの軽食と豆乳、牛乳、コーヒーなどを売る屋台がある。
sen.e: In Taiwan, street stalls open for business in the early morning, selling items such as: rice porridge, noodles, LuRo Fans, food made from rice, sandwiches, French toasts, rice balls, other light meals, soymilk, milk, and coffee.

sen.j: これらの屋台の中には、麺類、揚げ物、炒め物、カット果物、日本起源のたこ焼き、どら焼き、かき氷、刺身、寿司など多様な食品を提供するところもあれば、衣料品や雑貨を売る店もある。

Street stalls have become fairly popular with not only the local residents but also sightseeing tourists, from foreign nations.

sen.j: 有名な夜市として、台北市士林地区の「士林夜市」（北台湾最大規模）、大同区の「寧夏夜市」、萬華区の「華西街夜市」、松山区の「饒河街夜市」、台湾師範大学近くの「師大夜市」、台湾大学本部近くの「公館夜市」、台北県永和市の「楽華夜市」、台中市の「逢甲夜市」（中台湾最大規模）、高雄市の「六合夜市」などがある。
sen.e: Some of the more famous Night Market are: " the Shilin Night Market (Largest scale in northern Taiwan)" in the Shilin area of Taipei City, "the Ningsia Night Market" of Datong District, "the Huasi Street Night Market" of Wanhua District, "the Raohe Street Night Market" of Songshan District, "the Shida Night Market" near the National Taiwan Normal University, "the GongGuan Night Market" near the administration building of the National Taiwan Normal University, "the Le hua Night Market" of Yonghe City in Taipei County, "Fong Jia Night Market (the Largest scale in Middle Taiwan)" of Taichung City, and " the Liu He Night Market" of Kaohsiung City.

sen.j: 小都市の夜市は土曜日だけなど限られた日に立つ。
sen.e: The Night Market in the smaller cities are only opened a limited number of days, such as Saturday.

sen.j: 中華人民共和国の本土でも、台湾に似た形態の屋台が見られるが、売る食品は地域ごとに異なる。
sen.e: On the mainland the of People's Republic of China, there are street stalls similar in style to Taiwan, but the foods served in the shops of the street stalls in mainland China differ and are dependant on location.

sen.j: たとえば、北京市でみかける食品では、天津煎餅、焼き芋、ゆでトウモロコシ、甘栗などが多い。
sen.e: For example, foods commonly seen in Beijing City are: Tianjin Jianbing (Tianjin style egg crepe or pancake), roasted sweet potatoes, boiled corn, and broiled sweet chestnuts.

sen.j: 地域によっては、夕方以降、歩道や広場を使って衣料品、雑貨類を販売する大規模な市場が現れたり、歩行者天国状態にした、食品の屋台街が現れる場所もある。
sen.e: In the evening, there are places for large scale markets to open their businesses upon sidewalls; these market places sell clothing and miscellaneous goods, and there are other market locations; this is where the street stalls serve food upon streets temporarily closed to vehicle traffic.

tit.e: The street stalls of Hong Kong
The street stalls of Hong Kong

sen.j: 香港では、「大牌檔（広東語 ダーイパーイドン）（zh大牌檔）」と呼ばれる屋台が、麺類、粥、炒め物などの中華料理（広東料理が中心）を出している。
sen.e: In Hong Kong, a street stall is called a "大牌檔 (meaning "street stall", and can be pronounced as "Dai Pai Dong" in Cantonese)" serving Chinese food (Mainly Cantonese food)" such as rice porridge and stir-fried dishes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 1980年代以降路上での営業は禁止される地域が増えた。
sen.e: Many places have banned the operations of street stall business upon the roadway since the '1980's.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many places have banned the operations of street stall business upon the roadway since the '1980's.'

sen.j: 基本的に公園の一角のような定められた場所に集められて営業している。
sen.e: Therefore, today street stalls basically gather and operate their business in the designated places of certain parks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, today street stalls basically gather and operate their business in designated places in certain parks.

sen.j: ほかに、自動車を利用した移動販売店舗も認められるが、許可取得に要する費用が高く、営業できる場所も制限を受けるため、日本のように一般的ではない。
sen.e: Another type of mobile shop permitted, is one using motor vehicles, but this shop type is not common, unlike Japan; the expense in obtaining a license permit is very high; and the places of operation for these motorized stalls is very limited.

Another type of mobile shop that is permitted, is one that uses motor vehicles, but this shop type is not common, unlike Japan; the expense in obtaining a license permit is very high; and the places of operation for these motorized stalls is very limited.

sen.j: これ以外に、プロパンガスコンロを仕込んだカートを使って、煮込み料理、揚げ物などを売る業者が街角に現れることがあるが、基本的に無資格販売である。
sen.e: On some occasions, street stall carts using attached propane gas to cook food operate their businesses serving food such as; stew and deep-fried food at street corners, but basically, these sellers operate without licenses.

sen.j: 警官がパトロールに現れると、カートを押しながらクモの子を散らすように逃げる姿が見られる。
sen.e: Therefore, the shop vendors would need to run away, along with their carts, scattering like a birds, when a police patrol come down the street.

sen.e: Therefore, the shop vendors would need to run away, along with their carts, if a police patrol were to come down the street.

sen.j: 夜に道路を利用して店舗を出す例では、廟街や西洋菜街（女人街）が有名であるが、衣料品や雑貨の販売に限られる。
sen.e: Another famous example, of street stalls operating their businesses upon night time streets are, Temple Street and Sai Yeung Choi Street (Woman street), but these shops sell only clothing and miscellaneous goods.

tit.e: The street stalls of Southeastern Asia
The street stalls of Southeastern Asia
The street stalls of Southeastern Asia

sen.j: 日本では屋台は祭りの軽食や、あるいは夜の簡易酒場といった位置づけになりがちなのに対し、東南アジアでは屋台は庶民の生活により密着した存在である。
sen.e: Japanese people tend to subcategorized street stalls in Japan as a light meal for festivals, or a simple night time bar; but street stalls in Southeast Asia are businesses which are more closely intertwined with the daily lives of common people.

Japanese people tend to subcategorize street stalls in Japan as a light meal for festivals, or a simple night time bar; but street stalls in Southeast Asia are businesses which are more closely intertwined with the daily lives of common people.

sen.j: 昼食から営業し、持ち帰り用、あるいはその場で簡単な椅子とテーブルを備え本格的な料理を供する場合が多い。
sen.e: Street stalls open for business at lunch time, some shops sell take out food; many shops setup simple tables and chairs for their customers, serving conventional food.
Street stalls open for business at lunch time, some shops sell take out food; many shops setup simple tables and chairs for their customers, serving conventional food.

sen.j: お互いの店舗で厳しい生存競争にさらされていることが多い。
sen.e: Because the street stalls are often exposed to severe competition from one another, in order for the business to survive, the prices of food are generally reasonable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: そのため、一般的に値段が安く、味も満足のいく場合が多い（Mamak stall）。
sen.e: Subsequently, much of the food offered is very tasteful, this to satisfy the customers (Mamak stall).

sen.j: 本格的な食事を提供する屋台から、簡易屋台まで様々。
sen.e: Street stalls in Thailand are of various types, from fully equipped street stalls serving conventional meals, to simple street stalls.

sen.j: カオマンガイ、カオカムー、パッタイ、炒飯、ガイヤーン、カオナッペ、バミー、クイティアオ、タイ風カレー、トムヤンクンなどのタイ料理から場所によっては点心やパクテーなどの中華料理、カレーなどのインド料理やケバブなどのアラブ料理などがある。
sen.e: There are 'Vanity food' street stalls serving: Thai cuisine such as, Khao Man Kai (chicken and Rice), Khao Ka Moo (Pork Leg with Rice), Pad Thai (Fried Thai Noodles), Chinese-style fried rice, Gai Yang (Grilled Chicken), Kao Na Pad Yang (Duck on Rice Bed), Ba-Mee (Egg Noodles), Kway Teow (Rice Noodle),Thai Curry, and Tom Yum Goong (Hot and Sour Prawn Soup); there is Chinese food such as, dim sum (Chinese snacks) and Bak Kut Teh (Pork Bone Tea Soup); there is Indian food, such as curry; there is Arab cuisine, such as Kabob.
